description.narrative: Mothers newborns and children have equitable access to clean water, improved sanitation and hygiene at health facilities in targeted areas

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Mothers newborns and children have equitable access to clean water, improved sanitation and hygiene at health facilities in targeted areas

description.narrative: In 2019, the rehabilitation/construction and refurbishment of WASH infrastructure in 18 maternity units of district hospitals started and to be accomplished by end of Dec 2019 – January 2020. The improved facilities will enable access of 65,000 mothers and their new-borns in 18 maternities across the country annually from 2020 and will contribute to improved quality of Maternal, Neonatal and Child Health Care (MNCH) and towards the reduction of preventable neonatal mortality and morbidity in Tajikistan. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

title.narrative: % of HW in maternities with improved WASH practicing appropriate hygiene and sanitation behaviours
